page.title: 19A TRACTORMAN AT BLYTHBANK
page.content: MY FATHER WORKS AT BLYTHBANK WITH A GROUP OF PEOPLE WHO DRIVE TRACTORS, MAINLY BRITISH LAYLAND. THEY USE PLOUGHS, HARROWS, CULTIVATORS AND ROLLERS TO WORK THE GROUND AND SPRAYING AND DRAINING EQUIPMENT TO KEEP THE CROPS CLEAN. TO HARVEST THE CROPS THEY USE SILAGE MACHINES, MOWERS, DIGGERS AND BALERS. FOR STORAGE, THEY HAVE HAY SHEDS FOR HAY OR STRAW, SILAGE PITS FOR SILAGE, GRANARIES FOR GRAIN AND BARNS FOR CATTLE AND SHEEP CONCENTRATE FEEDING. THERE IS HOUSING FOR CATTLE, SOME SHEEP, CALVES, A MILKING PARLOUR AND A PLACE FOR CLIPPING AND WEIGHING SHEEP. MY FATHER USUALLY WORKS FROM 7PM TO 5PM HAVING 1 HOUR FOR LUNCH, BUT EVERY 2ND WEEKEND HE WORKS FROM 5AM TO 9AM AND 2.30PM TO 5 PM. HIS LATEST TRACTOR IS A MARSHALL.
